info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:52PM EDT until July 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL NICHOLAS...SOUTHEASTERN KANAWHA...CENTRAL RALEIGH... NORTHEASTERN WYOMING AND FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 352 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Smithers to 7 miles southeast of Burnwell to 7 miles east of Oceana, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Fayetteville, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Ansted, Sophia, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Bradley, Powellton, Hawks Nest State Park, Piney View, Stanaford, Coal City, and Prosperity. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
